alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 02 at 1:50PM CDT until May 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Into Early Evening for Parts of Southeast Minnesota and Northeast Iowa... .Humidities near 20 percent and northwest winds gusting as high as 35 mph will continue critical fire weather conditions into the early evening hours. While green-up is beginning, there are enough fuels to support quick starting, fast moving fires. Avoid any outdoor burning. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS FOR PORTIONS OF SOUTHEAST MINNESOTA AND NORTHEAST IOWA... * AFFECTED AREA...In Iowa, Mitchell and Floyd. In Minnesota, Dodge and Mower. * TIMING...This afternoon and evening. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 20 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 50s. * IMPACTS...any fires that start could quickly move, spreading rapidly and become hard to control. Please heed any local burning bands.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
